definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: The Charter scheme is expected to help enhance vehicle safety and improving roadside air quality.
sentences.chinese: 预期约章计划有助提高车辆安全和改善路边空气质素。

sentences.english: So far, the Charter has attracted over 120 workshops to sign up.
sentences.chinese: 至目前为止，已有超过120个维修工场签署约章。

sentences.english: The scheme aims at helping students to set up their personal objectives of their university life and learning.
sentences.chinese: 签署约章的目的在协助同学订定大学生活及学习目标。

sentences.english: The Charter for Youth enunciates principles and ideals in youth development.
sentences.chinese: 《青年约章》阐述青年发展的原则和理想。

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
Treaty of Lhasa (1904) between British empire and Tibet
open door policy/Egyptian President Sadat's infitah policy towards investment and relations with Israel
